intro: Sericanthe mpassa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, are pollinated primarily by insects.
